closed_reason: Read cmd/ticker/main.go and identified 4 subcommands: run (execute epics with AI agent), resume (continue from checkpoint), checkpoints (list saved checkpoints), and upgrade (update ticker version). Root command also has --version flag.
description: Read cmd/ticker/main.go and list all subcommands defined.

run.output:
I'll read the cmd/ticker/main.go file to list all subcommands defined.

Based on my reading of `cmd/ticker/main.go`, here are all the CLI subcommands defined:

**Subcommands:**

1. **`run`** (lines 53-75) - Run one or more epics with the AI agent
   - Usage: `ticker run <epic-id> [epic-id...]`
   - Flags: `--max-iterations/-n`, `--max-cost`, `--checkpoint-interval`, `--max-task-retries`, `--auto`, `--headless`, `--jsonl`, `--skip-verify`, `--verify-only`, `--worktree`, `--parallel`

2. **`resume`** (lines 77-85) - Resume from a checkpoint
   - Usage: `ticker resume <checkpoint-id>`
   - Requires exactly 1 argument (checkpoint ID)

3. **`checkpoints`** (lines 87-96) - List available checkpoints
   - Usage: `ticker checkpoints [epic-id]`
   - Optional argument to filter by epic

4. **`upgrade`** (lines 98-129) - Upgrade ticker to the latest version
   - Usage: `ticker upgrade`

The root command (`ticker`) also supports the `--version` flag (line 44).

Now I'll close the task and add an epic note.

Task complete. I identified the 4 CLI subcommands defined in `cmd/ticker/main.go`:

1. **`run`** - Run epics with the AI agent (supports multiple epics, various flags)
2. **`resume`** - Resume from a saved checkpoint
3. **`checkpoints`** - List available checkpoints
4. **`upgrade`** - Upgrade ticker to latest version

This was a read-only task requiring no code changes.

title: List CLI commands
